nodes.bodyText: @pollend Should those really be public? I'm a bit confused right now, as I thought we agreed on Slack with @4Denthusiast that we should ensure that invalid min/max combinations should throw exceptions. With these values publicly accessible we cannot guarantee that...
I'm pretty sure this logic is incorrect @4Denthusiast
maxZ, not minZ (and similarly for the other two).

I think this will have some implications, as it could not be null before.
I haven't double-checked where this component is used/accessed.
hmm, so an empty blockmap is null.

I'm not sure this is intuitive - while writing tests for this, I was wondering whether
BlockRegions.createFromCenterAndExtents(new Vector3i(), new Vector3i(0,0,0))
is valid or not, and what it should return. In the given implementation it is valid, as the extents are added to the center block, while the utility method might be interpreted in a way that "extents" refers to the final extents...

This is not public anymore, so there is hopefully no way to create invalid BlockRegions anymore. However, this comes in very handy when redcuing a list of positions in the encompassing helper methods, that's why I left it in...
Not sure what to do with it...
I wouldn't mark it as deprecated though.
